PRESIDENT
SEYMOUR N. SIEGEL
WNYC, Municipal Broadcasting System
2500 Municipal Building
New York 7, N. Y.
November 12, 1952
Mr. James Miles
Room 119 Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Jims
The pressure of things at home has kept me more than
occupied these first two days of the week. Now I would like
to get some NAEB business rolling*
Will you please give me a briefing on the total
relationship of the president to the headquarters operation
s seen from the position of the Executive Director. As
you know, I have been in on all the Board meetings in
determining policy, etc., but the details of operation be¬
tween you and Si are not included in my knowledge of the
situation. Specifically I need to know which, if any,
operational details are approved by the president, how
the funds provided for the president*s secretary, telephone
calls, etc. are handled between you and Frank. At the
post-session meeting in Minneapolis the Board authorised
1100.00 per month for secretarial help fcr my office and the
1500 contingency fund which has been approved for Si. I
oo not know how these funds have been handled, so please
inform me.
At our advance meetings several actions were
taken which gave specific directives to the incoming
president* I would appreciate your giving me a rundowi
on those as soon as possible - perhaps even before you
get the minutes completed for distribution to the Board.
Now that you are both Mr. Secretary and Mr.
Executive Secretary, what is your next deadline for a
newsletter and what specific contributions would you like
from me for that newsletter*
DIRECTOR OF STUDIES
DALLAS W. SMYTHE
